item.title: Collections of Windows software and utilities

ul.li: Planet Mirror -- Asia Pacific's largest online software repository [cpatti]
Zdnet shareware -- complete listing with evaluations
Softseek programming -- shareware and evaluation software (part of ZDnet)
Cetus Links -- A remarkable list of lists - languages, object technologies, methodologies, infrastructure, you name it. [cpatti]
CPAN and search-- Perl modules and source
DBVisualizer -- a good Oracle client [wsargent, awaltman].
MySQL -- database for Bugzilla.
MySql Control Center -- good beta of a MySQL client for Linux and Windows [adamb]. See the Bugzilla FAQ on mysqlcc and myadmin.
MySQL/MyAdmin -- MySQL client for custom queries and remote admin [bradb].
MySQL/MyODBC -- ODBC driver for MySql. See Using Excel for custom queries with MyODBC
TOAD -- Oracle client. TOAD is really great. It's much more powerfull than oracle's own clients and it's free [ashish].
Trillian -- connect to everyone [jwang, matt]
Netscape e-mailer -- installed by IT. Good search.
Outlook Express -- "It's way less buggy and otherwise quite similar." [jimf]. Try QuoteFix [see employee.atg.com for IS notes, mlandau]

Eudora Pro 5.0 -- Good UI and search. Stores each email folder as one text file. Stores attachments in a download directory [bradb]. The sponsored version is free and not overly intrusive [cpatti, bradb]. Stores mail as text files. See Getting Started on using Eudora with Outlook.

WinSCP - scp client (secure copy), Launch the winscp executable. Enter in the host name (pyros.atg.com and your network username and password. Now double click on your public_html folder. From here you will need to select files or folders in windows explorer and drag them to the winscp gui. Easy as that. [bartonn]
ws_ftp -- good reputation
LeechFTP -- freeware FTP client
CuteFTP -- easy to use with plenty of features [bradb]
Ifranview -- Great freeware gif/jpg/whatever viewer and manipulator [cpatti].
SmartDraw -- good alternative to Visio, inexpensive [cpatti]
1st Page 2000 -- free HTML editor [fkim]
Macromedia's Homesite is an excellent html editor [cherylm]. It does not rewrite your html codes (most of the time). For help: EZwebdesign, and WebMonkey [cherylm]
Office HTML Filter -- an MS Word add-on that generates simpler HTML than Save as HTML.[cherylm]. HomeSite includes CodeSweeper and HtmlTidy with lots of customization.
TableMaker -- create html tables. See also HomeSite's table wizard [cherylm].
Tidy, TidyGUI -- HTML syntax checker [fkim]
Eclipse -- Full-featured Java IDE, with lots of useful plug-ins [sdrye]
FindBugs -- identify potential bugs in Java source via source code and flow analysis. [sdrye]
Optibench -- detailed performance analysis [ruthm]

Websphere Studio Application Developer (900 Megs) -- It is Eclipse based, but fills in some nice holes. [Blake Crawford]
it automatically publishes applications to WAS and keeps a WAS instance running in the background
automatically verifies, compiles, updates, and reloads application changes on WAS
has a JSP editor that, while lacking the detailed code-completion of other IDEs, does have source, preview, and visual design modes for editing
has a really nice interface for working with deployment descriptors.
JPad Pro from modelworks.com -- like UltraEdit with good Java support [jscott]

jEdit will not only color code jsp correctly, but it will figure out when you've escaped into Java code and use java formatting correctly in that section. It also does JHTML and RelationalViews formatting. [wsargent]
Nifty Telnet SSH/SCP -- good telnet client [bartonn]
DiskTop -- all the facts and commands for Mac directories.
DiskTracker -- catalog and manage your disks and directories.

Beyond Compare -- file and directory comparison with lots of features. New licenses are $13 apiece [ATG has 10 licenses so far]. To compare ATG distribution files, Change 'Zip Extensions' in Tools>Options>Folder View> to "zip;jar;ear;war;dar". To compare all files in an ATG distribution, unpack the distribution first.
Guiffy Merge -- multiplatform diff and 3-way merge (Java-based)
Araxis Merge -- Windows diff and 3-way merge [tleblanc]. How to install in Perforce.
Perforce -- 3-way merge and diff from Perforce with list of other merge tools
NetStumbler -- monitor the wireless network [nboyd]
XML Spy -- IDE for XML and XSLT [ruthm]

Open Office -- office suite for all major platforms with XML file format and excellent html export. "In terms of offering the features I need without getting in my way, OpenOffice has been the clear winner in all my recent projects." [cpatti]
PDF Converter -- convert Word docs to pdf files for the web.
ButtonBoogie -- move buttons on your taskbar ZDNet search "ButtonBoogie"
ContextEdit -- edit your context menu by file type ZDNet search "ContextEdit"
Freedom of Association -- manage file type associations. ZDNet search "Freedom Association"
Startup Cop -- manage your start up programs. ZDNet search "Startup Cop"
TrayIcon -- launch program by clicking icon on system tray. ZDNet search: TrayIcon

Msched -- macro scheduler with hot keys and scripting language. Combine with TrayIcon. 5 stars from ZDnet. "I use Macro Scheduler (available as shareware at www.mjtnet.com) which has some small limitations, but generally rocks." [timm]
How to switch Ctl and CapsLock [Ashish, be careful].
Quickeys -- keyboard macros, text macros, screen capture. GUI interface. See www.cesoft.com [bradb]
tweakui -- remove "shortcut to" and other improvements. Unpack in a directory. Right click on tweakui.inf and select install. Either reboot or click on WinNT\tweakui.cpl.
Command prompt here -- access the DOS box from Explorer. Execute the installer. Right click on DOSHERE.INF and select install.
Desktop Menu -- access your desktop from the Taskbar. Execute the installer. Move DESKMENU.EXE to your start directory. Execute to use it without rebooting.
SendTo -- do more with the send to menu. Execute the installer. Right click on SENDTOX.INF and select install.

item.title: Programmer's Editors, Text Editors, and IDEs

ul.li: See Java software below.

XEmacs for Windows NT. Emacs - The Next Generation. Using XEmacs nifty 'EFS' functionality, you can specify a path like: /cpatti@nibbler:/work/releng/DCS/5.0/Makefile and XEmacs will automatically use FTP to get/put the file. The home page is www.xemacs.org. Cons: xemacs over the network is slower than emacs inside CRT or telnet. Also the control keys in emacs are hard on the wrist.
GNU Emacs software distribution for NT.
Textpad -- full-featured replacement for Notepad. Recommended [tleblanc, jlang, bradb]. See Plasma #8629 for Dynamo syntax and clip libraries [tobrien].
UniPad -- free text editor with full Unicode support [lizanne]
Visual C++ -- excellent editor with multifile search, keyboard macros, and navigation bar [bradb]. 'Help:keyboard map' includes useful keys. For example F4 goes to the next search result.
Codewrite -- programmer's editor with an excellent multi-file search and replace. Somewhat difficult to configure. [bradb].
UltraEdit -- includes tabbed interface to open files [wredmond]. See Plasma #8356 for Dynamo and Java syntax files [billon].
Cygwin and tcsh -- Tcsh shell for NT and Unix
zsh -- better than bash/tcsh [cpatti]
ActivePython -- installers for Python on Win NT, Solaris, and Linux. The Cygwin package includes python for NT. See py2exe for stand-alone executables [rollin].
ATG's VPN -- Logon is faster if you change 'Dial up networking', Properties:ServerTypes, and unclick Log on to network, NetBEUI, IPX/SPX Compatible [bradb].
CRT -- telnet and terminal emulator. IT has a license. Use SecureCRT for SSH.
PuTTY - a great, free, SSH/telnet client for Win32 [cpatti] home page
VNC -- remote access to NT servers and other hosts.
TeraTerm Pro -- on shareware.com [LaMantia, Baron]
eXceed -- X window server. IT has licenses.
Procomm Plus -- solid VT100 emulation. Tries to do too much. [bradb]

netcat -- The swiss army knife of networking tools. You can create everything from a simple network pipe to a simple server with a single command line invocation. Also good for diagnosing network problems. [cpatti]
WWW Security FAQ.
Planet Mirror -- Asia Pacific's largest online software repository [cpatti]
Guiffy Merge, a Java-based merge tool with intra-line diffs. [Andrew Jacobs]
Solaris freeware -- Freeware packaged for Solaris [Matt Rice].
ActivePython -- installers for Python on Win NT, Solaris, and Linux. The Cygwin package includes python for NT.
pylice -- HTML links checker in Python or java

Netscape 7 -- based on the Mozilla browser -- works with Bugzilla, performance bug on very, long pages.
LiveHTTPHeaders -- Mozilla addon for viewing HTTP headers and cookies [fkim]
Opera -- fast, works with Bugzilla, breaks on IE sites.
Internet Explorer -- what else
Tiny URL -- create short, URL aliases for any link
winzip -- a standard. They have a command-line version.
